params.amount: The amount of tokens to be deposited
params.rate: The rate at which to bid for a bonds
params.to: The address for which the position is created
params.underlyingToken: The contract address of the token to be deposited*

returns.bondsQuantity: Quantity of bond held, represents funds borrowed
returns.normalizedDepositedAmount: Amount of deposit placed on yield provider*

returns.adjustedBalance: Adjusted balance of the position original deposit
returns.bondsIssuanceIndex: Borrow period the deposit was made in*
returns.bondsMaturity: Maturity of the position's remaining bonds
returns.remainingBonds: Quantity of bonds remaining in the position after a partial withdraw
returns.underlyingToken: Address of the tokens the position contains

params.newRate: The new rate at which to bid for bonds*

Deposit(address,uint128,uint128,uint128,.notice: Emitted when #deposit is called and is a success

UpdateRate(address,uint128,uint128,uint1.notice: Emitted when #updateRate is called and is a success

Withdraw(address,uint128,uint128,uint128.notice: Emitted when #withdraw is called and is a success

deposit(address,uint128,uint128,bytes32,.notice: Deposits tokens into the yield provider and places a bid at the indicated rate within the respective pool's order book. A new position is created within the positions map that keeps track of this position's composition. An ERC721 NFT is minted for the user as a representation of the position.

getPositionRepartition(uint128).notice: Returns the balance on yield provider and the quantity of bond held

position(uint128).notice: Emitted when #withdraw is called and is a success

updateRate(uint128,uint128).notice: Allows a user to update the rate at which to bid for bonds. A rate is only upgradable as long as the full amount of deposits are currently allocated with the yield provider i.e the position does not hold any bonds.

withdraw(uint128).notice: Withdraws the amount of tokens that are deposited with the yield provider. The bonds portion of the position is not affected.
